com.service.kerberos.rest.api

Interface IKerberosAuthenticationAPI

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    KerberosAuthenticationAPIImpl

    public interface IKerberosAuthenticationAPI
    It provides the methods necessary for performing Kerberos Authentication
    Author:
    raunak

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Map<KerberosAuthenticationAPIImpl.AuthenticationResponseAttributes,java.lang.String> authenticate(java.lang.String url, java.lang.String loginName, java.lang.String password)
      Performs Kerberos App Authentication
      javax.crypto.SecretKey generatePasswordSymmetricKey(java.lang.String loginAppName, java.lang.String appPassword)

    • Method Detail

      • authenticate

        java.util.Map<KerberosAuthenticationAPIImpl.AuthenticationResponseAttributes,java.lang.String> authenticate(java.lang.String url,
                                                                                                          java.lang.String loginName,
                                                                                                          java.lang.String password)
                                                                                                            throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                                                                   RestClientException,
                                                                                                                   ResponseDecryptionException
        Performs Kerberos App Authentication
        Parameters:
        String - url of the Kerberos Server to be called for Authentication
        String - App Login Name
        String - App Password
        Returns:
        Map
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - In case there are some errors encountered while retrieving information
        RestClientException - If the status of the response is not 200. The server side error message and error response code can be accessed using getMessage and getErrorCode methods respectively
        ResponseDecryptionException - If the Application was unable to decrypt the Response sent by the server

      • generatePasswordSymmetricKey

        javax.crypto.SecretKey generatePasswordSymmetricKey(java.lang.String loginAppName,
                                                  java.lang.String appPassword)
        Returns a SecretKey generated using App Login Name and Password
        Parameters:
        String - App Login Name
        String - App Password
        Returns:
        SecretKey generated using Login Name and Password
